Movicol-Paediatric<tm tmtype="reg"/> Indications and dose

Chronic constipation

Prevention of faecal impaction

By mouth

  • Child 2–5 years

    1 sachet daily, adjust dose to produce regular soft stools; maximum 4 sachets per day.

  • Child 6–11 years

    2 sachets daily, adjust dose to produce regular soft stools; maximum 4 sachets per day.

Faecal impaction

By mouth

  • Child 5–11 years

    Initially 4 sachets daily on first day, then increased in steps of 2 sachets daily, total daily dose to be taken over a 12-hour period, after disimpaction, switch to maintenance laxative therapy; maximum 12 sachets per day.

 Unlicensed use

Movicol Paediatric not licensed for use in faecal impaction in children under 5 years, or for chronic constipation in children under 2 years.
Contra-indications

Cardiovascular impairment

Contra-indicated in renal impairment.
Cautions

Impaired consciousness (with high doses); impaired gag reflex (with high doses); reflux oesophagitis (with high doses)

Directions for administration

Contents of each sachet to be dissolved in quarter of a glass (approx. 60–65 mL) of water; after reconstitution the solution should be kept in a refrigerator and discarded if unused after 24 hours.
